I just had the hottest dream.

Walked in to get a tattoo, a tattoo designed on intuition alone. I felt sexy, slinky, smooth and soft. He looked me up and down, and could sense my excitement. His eyes glowed with excitement and recognition and he moved closer

"I have an idea, come with me to the back room"

I followed, and took my clothes off down to just the basics. I stood there, exposed and excited while his eyes went up and down over my body. He reached out, touched his fingertips to the small of my back, the curve of my hips. His eyes met mine and he leaned in closer. Feeling his breath close and hot on my cheek, he whispered in my ear "yes, that's what I want to do... sit down"

I sat on the table, aching, while he prepared his tools. He knew how much he was teasing, and he smirked while he set up. He slid over smoothly, and placed his hands on my ribs, giving me a gentle nudge to lay down on my side. I obeyed. He helped me take the rest of my clothes off and once again he stood for a moment, admiring.

Then came the pen.

"I must draw it straight on you, while the inspiration is hitting me" He could see just how excited I was getting, and he reveled in it while he started drawing.

The pen ran up my thigh, over my hip, and into the small of my back again and again. The feeling was soft, then sharp, then long and smooth once more. I turned over as he continued the design onto my back, my belly, my other side. Each line of the design let him trace my body with his gaze, and I could no longer keep my composure.

I shut my eyes, in hopes that I could control myself, but that only made him change the stroke of the pen - more stimulation, closer and closer he brought his face to my skin. Soon each line he drew was punctuated by a kiss on my skin. I had to open my eyes, to see, and when I did I saw his smile again and met his eyes. I was to enjoy this, and watch him enjoying it also - I obeyed.

"Now, my love... the ink." He moved forward and kissed me full upon the lips. It was passionate, and my whole body tingled before he pulled away and left the room. It seemed like hours before returned, tattoo gun in hand, to sit in the chair and start mixing inks.

"Go look at the design, see if you like it" he said, and I stood to look in the full length mirror at my decorated body. Beautiful swirls of waves crashing into the rocky beach, tiger lilies opening up to the sun and water on my thighs - each line, each flower sitting perfectly to accent my body.

He came up behind me, putting his hands on my hips and kissing at my neck, "The best is on the back" he said, turning me around to face him. "Look"

I turned my head back towards the mirror to see a lotus flower, perched right in the nook of the small of my back. The lines of the waves turned upwards into leaves framing the lotus, following the natural curve into my waist. "It's beautiful, Chris, it's beautiful." I said, turning back to him. I wanted so badly to kiss him once more, but his hands were firm on my hips as he pushed me away slightly.

"Then we begin." I layed back down on the table, and he started outlining his drawing. The sting of the gun was sharper at first than I remembered, and my hands gripped the table to cope with it. He started with the bands around my thighs, then worked the lotus on my back, the design on my belly, the lilies, the color. As the sharpness of the gun faded, the pain was softer, more exquisite. It was all I could do to contain my lust.

It was almost done, I knew, and with each passing moment he'd been moving closer. I could feel his breath again, against my collarbone, and I closed my eyes again in ecstacy. The tattoo gun stopped, and instead his gloved hand ran up my thigh, gripping me at the hips, and I heard his breath hesitate before he kissed me again. I could no longer control myself.

I moaned, wrapping my arms around him and gripping my fingers into his hair to pull him closer. I felt his body react, felt him move, and before I knew it, he was as naked as I, excited as I, and his arms wrapped around me again. He slid me gently off the table, held me strongly so I needn't move, and slid me onto him. Immediately my aching ceased and switched to hot and passionate lust.

His hands once more gripped my hips, trying to direct me, but I shook them off and gripped his head tighter as I pulled his head back to whisper in his ear, "My turn now" as I moved down to kiss and bite at his neck. With each bite I feigned, he gasped slightly, but with excitement at the teasing. I slid myself up and down him, and his head tilted back against his chair with a moan. "More" he panted, "more"

We became more empassioned, moving with each other faster, harder. His head leaned forward, his eyes once more taking me all in, then meeting my eyes with a wink. "I'm not done with you yet..."

He reached over, changed his glove, and once more picked up the tattoo gun, dipping it into the blue ink of the sea. I had to make my movements smoother, gliding up and down while he tattooed. I could tell he was concentrating, but the movements of my hips brought the lines of the waves to life. The subtle ripples, the long curving movement of the ocean meeting the beach, was all a part of our ecstasy. As each line was finished, I could feel him harden all the more.

The tattooing, the sex, all of it was one. The sting of the gun was gone completely now, and left in its wake just aching. I knew as each line was finished we came closer to finishing together. My excitement built, and my head leaned back. My moans grew louder, each movement more defined. His other hand fell to my hip, pulling me down on him harder. As I felt him finish the last line, I heard the clunk of the tattoo gun on his tray, and his tattooing hand return to my hip.

The last few thrust were sheer bliss as the two of us came together, writhing and moaning, his hands tight on my hips. I felt him come inside me, and felt the release of all that energy, and I fell against him gently, leaning my head onto his shoulder. "My gods... that was..." I started.

"Shhhhh..." as a finger met my lips. "Come see how beautiful it is..." We separated and I stood up, led over to the mirror, where I could see the tattoo and our naked bodies together. The image was perfect. The stark colored beauty of the tattoo mirrored the passion of what had just happened. The lilies exploded in color where his hands had gripped my hips and slid down my thighs. The red on my belly accented the muscles I had used to move me. He turned me around once more and we leaned in for one last kiss before leaving.

I didn't need to look, I knew exactly where the lotus sat - where I had felt the both of us come together, felt the explosion of lust before the calm and soothing glow of meditative bliss.

The kiss was perfect. The tattoo was perfect. He helped me bandage it as he helped me dress. With one more kiss, I departed, off to go savor the memory had with each viewing of those waves...

Today has been filled with fantasies...

Of all the things I'd like to do to you when you come home... of sitting and waiting in surprise - and stunning you the minute you walk through the door. Your kisses last night felt like sparks against my skin - thrilling and beautiful. The smirk on your face before leaning in to kiss me beneath my ear. The spot that is lovingly yours...

My heart and my lust today are well-mixed. And I cannot wait for you to come home.

i had earlier been ravenous, playful, full of life, and now lie wilted music echoes through, a delicate piece intended for those angelic voices that come along once in a lifetime he was singing to me that night, a lullaby. gentle, soft, angelic, not understanding the peace it brought he was just trying to soften an evening of stress a lullaby to soothe the soul and a walk, hand-in-hand, to my cabin i remember. i remember everything about you, the way the afternoon sun caught your eyes, the gleam of armor, and seeing you for the first time as a soldier feeling your protective wings spread over me the one time you ever saw my tears fall the night of the lullaby, a night of love unconditional a night of love without expectations, i oft write of passion, and lust, and at times of deep held love. and mayhaps not often enough of the tender moments of life of love held not within lovers. of the love held between the brothers and sisters to our spirit love that will not fade, that will not turn its face to danger love that never once has forgotten the good times through the bad. a lover's love is wonderful, magnificent, passionate, and yes... i miss it greatly, milord... and you always shall be milord... and at the same time... such tempered love can be present in a life, i am grateful it has entered mine. i sit tonight and remember, for you, my brother. i remember your eyes, the sound of a knowing sigh when my tears fell and the sound of your voice, angelic rising into the starred sky. a lullaby. milord, do you see now? why i fell asleep so soon after you sang? why it calmed me to the core? you showed me tempered, even, lasting love. tonight, i raise my glass. i remember the both of you tonight. i remember my brother, and i remember milord, and tonight, i miss you both with such a sting like a match to the heart.

tonight my soul is howling
the cold wind freeze dries the world
and we all settle beneath the covers
trying for every degree of warmth
it is a night for the low end of piano
pounding deep and rich
stirring and moving
with an ethereal and unholdable voice
floating above with eerie harmony.

it is a night for howling, my pack

the cold and snow outside
only drives me further into the warmth of life
the smell of food cooking
the ringing tones of laughter
the warmth of friends and family
learning, sharing, and growing

this is the season to remember warmth
and to let the bear within you hibernate
she needs her rest to be able to handle 
the summer months of stress and questions

soon we will gather
and bring back the sun
to remind the great father of all that is good in this world
and remember within ourselves the same

we gather now the supplies we need to make it through
we gather to remind ourselves
that we carry within ourselves everything we need
to survive the coldest darkest winters.

still here.

crying one, look and see what you almost did.
look around you and see. he's not gone. he's right where he said he'd be. do not fall at his feet in tears... those are exactly the pits you're staying out of.

you had a hard day, crying one, little one,

you were terrified, you had flashbacks, you were trying to help yourself... and when the nurse held you, you called for him
you didn't know he wasn't there. i didn't tell you. because i was there. i thought it would all be ok. and it wasn't, and i'm sorry. i've been here all day trying to help you

yes, you wanted more than anything to have arms wrapped around you when you got home - but you refused to see my own open arms, looking only for the arms of a few. yes, you wanted to let go, to cry, to mourn for the memories that were stirred and those that were created today. i was right here. i gave you texas toast. i gave you cold, fresh water. i gave you geek movies. Druid watched over to make sure the two of us were ok, and yet still you hid.

you showed your face for a minute, to admit to what happened to the two of them... and then ran and hid under the arms of someone 3000 miles away - you tried to pull him into your hiding with you.

now, little one,

cut the shit.
i know you're sad. i know you miss him. so do i. i've seen the pits, you dragged me into them, through them - and you tried to drag him through, too...

but they're like quicksand, those pits. you have to swim out on your own. pulling on anyone only gets you deeper.

cut the shit.

yes, cry. cry, mourn, howl... do what you need to do. but don't think for a second you are going through it alone. i am right here.

no more pity party, little one. you have everything you need right within you. you do not need anything beyond yourself. for you are me, and i am you. i am always here. my arms hold the same love and warmth for you as they ever did for him.

little one, he's not gone... he's standing in his world. you'll need to stand up in yours to be able to see him.

i'm standing, stand next to me. come on... stop pulling on my leg. stand up with me. if you don't stand up... that's your own choice. but i'm standing, hear me? i'm not losing sight. i'll hold you when you cry, but i'm not sitting back down again. ever.

i'm standing.
i have a sobbing child at my feet, a sobbing teenager, too.
sometimes it's awfully tempting to lay down there with them and cry...... and sometimes i do. but never again will i live there with them. it's an old world down there, it's a sad world down there, where nothing makes sense.

i laid there for months, thinking my support would raise them up. i gave myself to their tears, and it did not work. it only made me forget what there was to stand up for.

so, let them cry. at this point, that's all they know how to do.
i'm standing. i like the view.
i'm not sitting down there again.
